qoute: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
Tis sometimes the height of wisdom to feign stupidity.
Experience increases our wisdom but doesn't reduce our follies.
A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
The end of wisdom is to dream high enough to lose the dream in the seeking of it.
Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
Committing a great truth to memory is admirable; committing it to life is wisdom.
Action should culminate in wisdom.
A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
Tis sometimes the height of wisdom to feign stupidity.
Experience increases our wisdom but doesn't reduce our follies.
A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
The end of wisdom is to dream high enough to lose the dream in the seeking of it.
Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
Committing a great truth to memory is admirable; committing it to life is wisdom.
Action should culminate in wisdom.
A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
A great memory is never made synonymous with wisdom, any more than a dictionary would be called a treatise.
A proverb is one man's wit and all men's wisdom.
Experience comprises illusions lost, rather than wisdom gained.
I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
Magnanimity in politics is not seldom the truest wisdom; and a great empire and little minds go ill together.
Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
The beginning of wisdom is to desire it.
A cold, and cynical wisdom particularly disapproves of most men's best actions.
A man never reaches that dizzy height of wisdom that he can no longer be lead by the nose.
A short saying often contains much wisdom.
All delay is helpful, but it does produce wisdom.
All free governments are managed by the combined wisdom and folly of the people.
Apothegms are portable wisdom, the quintessential extracts of thought and feelings.
Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than to polish.
Beauty is the index of a larger fact than wisdom.
Behold, my son, with what little wisdom the world is ruled.
Books give not wisdom where none was before. But where some is, there reading makes it more.
Books should to one of these fours ends conduce, for wisdom, piety, delight, or use.
Cleverness is not wisdom.
Counsel woven into the fabric of real life is wisdom.
Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
Experiences are savings which a miser puts aside. Wisdom is an inheritance which a wastrel cannot exhaust.
Few persons have sufficient wisdom to prefer censure, which is useful, to praise which deceives them.
Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.
Full of wisdom are the ordinations of fate.
Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.
Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
Has fortune dealt you some bad cards. Then let wisdom make you a good gamester.
He swallowed a lot of wisdom, but all of it seems to have gone down the wrong way.
He who exercises wisdom exercises the knowledge which is about God.
Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.
I am thinking of taking a fifth wife. Why not? Solomon had a thousand wives and he is a synonym for wisdom.
I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
If I am fool, it is, at least, a doubting one; and I envy no one the certainty of his self-approved wisdom.
If I don't have wisdom, I can teach you only ignorance.
If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
In goodness there are all kinds of wisdom.
In seeking wisdom thou art wise; in imagining that thou hast attained it, thou art a fool.
In the vain laughter of folly wisdom hears half its applause.
Incredulity is the wisdom of the fool.
Innocence dwells with Wisdom, but never with Ignorance.
It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
It is astonishing with how little wisdom mankind can be governed, when that little wisdom is its own.
It is characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
It is costly wisdom that is bought by experience.
It is costly wisdom that is bought by experience.
It is great wisdom to know how to be silent and to look at neither the remarks, nor the deeds, nor the lives of others.
It is not from reason that justice springs, but goodness is born of wisdom.
It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
It is the province of knowledge to speak and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom.
It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.
Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
Kindness is wisdom.
Knowing that you are going to die is, I suspect, the beginning of wisdom.
Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
Knowledge is proud that he has learn'd so much; wisdom is humble that he knows no more.
Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; Wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
Knowledge shrinks as wisdom grows.
Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
Knowledge which is divorced from justice, may be called cunning rather than wisdom.
Let us not take ourselves too seriously. None of us has a monopoly on wisdom.
Losing faith in your own singularity is the start of wisdom, I suppose; also the first announcement of death.
Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
Memory is not wisdom; idiots can by rote repeat volumes. Yet what is wisdom without memory?
Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
Men who know themselves are no longer fools. They stand on the threshold of the door of Wisdom.
Mingle some brief folly with your wisdom.
Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
Morality comes with the sad wisdom of age, when the sense of curiosity has withered.
More helpful than all wisdom is one draught of simple human pity that will not forsake us.
More wisdom is latent in things as they are than in all the words men use.
Much of the wisdom of one age, is the folly of the next.
Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn.
Nature never says one thing and wisdom another.
Nine-tenths of wisdom consists in being wise in time.
Now that I am sixty, I see why the idea of elder wisdom has passed from currency.
Of all things which wisdom provides to make life entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
Oh that wisdom was half as zealous for converts as ridicule.
One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.
Our happiness depends on wisdom all the way.
Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack. We give it orders which make no sense.
Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
Pessimism is only the name that men of weak nerve give to wisdom.
Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.
Rightly defined philosophy is simply the love of wisdom.
Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.
Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
Silence is as full of potential wisdom and wit as the unshown marble of great sculpture.
Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
Some wisdom you must learn from one who's wise.
Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
Teach you children poetry; it opens the mind, lends grace to wisdom and makes the heroic virtues hereditary.
That which seems the height of absurdity in one generation often becomes the height of wisdom in the next.
The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
The beginning of wisdom is a definition of terms.
The doors of wisdom are never shut.
The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is the knowledge of our own ignorance.
The enemy of the conventional wisdom is not ideas but the march of events.
The extreme limit of wisdom -that's what the public calls madness.
The greatest wisdom is to realize one's lack of it
The growth of wisdom may be gauged exactly by the diminution of ill temper.
The hours of folly are measured by the clock, but of wisdom no clock can measure.
The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
The mintage of wisdom is to know that rest is rust, and that real life is love, laughter, and work.
The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
The most foolish kind of a book is a kind of leaky boat on the sea of wisdom; some of the wisdom will get in anyhow.
The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.
The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
The only thing that we know is that we know nothing and that is the highest flight of human wisdom.
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
The road to excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
The road to wisdom? Well, it's plain and simple to express: Errand err again but less and less and less.
The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
The teacher gives not of his wisdom, but rather of his faith and lovingness.
The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
The visible mark of extraordinary wisdom and power appear so plainly in all the works of creation.
The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.
The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages are perpetuated by quotations.
The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
There is a time when a man distinguishes the idea of felicity from the idea of wealth; it is the beginning of wisdom.
There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
There is no great concurrence between learning and wisdom.
There is no wisdom like frankness.
They must change who would be constant in happiness and wisdom.
They would need to be already wise, in order to love wisdom.
This is the highest wisdom that I own; freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
Though wisdom cannot be gotten for gold, still less can be gotten without it.
To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
To hazard much to get much has more of avarice than wisdom.
To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
We all admire the wisdom of people who come to us for advice.
We can be knowledgeable with other men's knowledge, but we cannot be wise with other men's wisdom.
We estimate the wisdom of nations by seeing what they did with their surplus capital.
We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
We have no words for speaking of wisdom to the stupid. He who understands the wise is wise already.
We thought, because we had power, we had wisdom.
What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
When a man grows old, wisdom will not keep him alive.
Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information.
Where love and wisdom drink out of the same cup, in this everyday world, it is the exception.
Wisdom alone is the science of others sciences.
Wisdom and goodness to the vile seem vile; filths savour but themselves.
Wisdom begins at the end.
Wisdom begins in wonder.
Wisdom comes by disillusionment.
Wisdom denotes the pursuing of the best Ends by the best Means.
Wisdom deprives even poverty of half its power.
Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
Wisdom hath her excesses, and no less need of moderation than folly.
Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
Wisdom is found only in truth.
Wisdom is knowing what to do next, skill is knowing how to do it, and virtue is doing it.
Wisdom is learning what to overlook.
Wisdom is meaningless until our own experience has given it meaning.
Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability.
Wisdom is not wisdom when it is derived from books alone.
Wisdom is nothing more than healed pain.
Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd preferred to talk.
Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
Wisdom makes a slow defense against trouble, though a sure one in the end.
Wisdom not only gets, but once got, retains.
Wisdom oft times consists of knowing what to do next.
Wisdom overcomes fortune.
Wisdom stands at the turn in the road and calls upon us publicly, but we consider it false and despise its adherents.
Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
Wisdom we know is the knowledge of good and evil - not the strength to choose between the two.
Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
You must learn to translate wisdom and strong feelings into labor.
Your aim will be knowledge and wisdom, not the reflected glamour of fame.
A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
A prudent question is one half of wisdom.
